there's one more impactful thing that da
Vinci Code has done more so than any of

mentioned it exposed the Opus day to the

foreign
ature of the Holy Cross and Opus day
more commonly referred to as Opus Dei is
a Catholic institution that according to
Britannica seek personal Christian
Holiness and strive to imbue their work
in society with Christian principles
Opus day is an international lay
Catholic group with networks all across
the globe all United in understanding
the baptismal calling of Holiness and
evangelization the Opus day was founded
on October 2nd 1928 by Spanish priest
father Jose Maria escriva in Madrid
Spain escriva would name the
organization as Opus Dei Latin for work
of God as he claims to have witnessed a
vision the day he was establishing the
group escriva claims that Opus day's
mission is to help ordinary Christians
to understand that their life is a way
of Holiness and evangelization and to
those who grasp this ideal of Holiness
the work offers the spirit spiritual
assistance and training they need to put
it into practice
initially only men were allowed to be
part of the organization becoming laymen
of the organization in two years time in
1930 escriva would then realize the
importance of women in Catholicism
thanks to a communication with God as he
claims it wasn't until 1947 that the
organization became official in the
sense that it was granted a decree of
praise and approval from Pope Pius XIII
making it an Institute of pontifical
right or an organization directly under
the governance of the Pope this was soon
followed by a definitive approval in
1950 allowing married people to join the
organization and secular clergy to be
admitted to the Priestly Society of the
Holy Cross Association of Catholic
diocesean priests
today the Opus day has over 95 000
members worldwide in more than 90
countries most of which are found in
Europe and the United States of America
2 000 of these 95 000 are said to be
priests interestingly 70 of the Opus day
members live in their own homes but
their own lives families and careers
while 30 percent are fully dedicated to
the organization practicing celibacy and
living in Opus day centers regardless of
Lifestyle all members are expected to
perform charity and social work as well
as train others to live a Catholic life
while all seems well and good there has
to be a reason why Dan Brown Put a
spotlight on the dark side of Opus Dei
right
on the surface Opus day is just like
many other Catholic institutions they
follow the Catholic Doctrine and place
importance on certain aspects of it pray
at specific times and help people in and
out of the organization to live a
Christian Life Opus Day places emphasis
on the Catholic doctrine's Universal
call to Holiness which focuses on the
ordinary Catholics that are neither
monks nor priests since the majority of
the people in the organization are not
priests and do not have monks because of
this Opus day focuses on interjecting
Christian values and beliefs in multiple
aspects of everyday life such as in
school in work or at home to achieve
this the lay people of Opus day hold
seminars workshops Retreats classes and
even one-on-one coaching beyond the
surface however there are very
questionable things the Opus tape leaves
in and practices these are tantamount to
critics and journalists going far as
calling the Opus day one of the most
controversial forces in the Catholic
church one questionable view that the
Opus day has is its view on women from
the get-go eskriva's exclusion of women
in the foundational years of the
organization already feels off but the
inclusion two years after balanced this
irrational Choice despite this women
were never treated equally as men even
if 57 of the Opus day members are women
men and women are segregated in classes
Retreats Living Spaces and even until
the entrance of Opus day centers the
separation of gender is a common sight
for stricter religions but what isn't as
common is to have Females Be assistance
to men escriva claims that the female
influence is needed for the Opus day
centers to function and while this is
true the way the Opus day applied this
concept in practice is questionable
women are expected to serve men cook for
them clean after them sew for them and
basically do household chores for them
take note that only female members of
the Opus day are expected to do this and
fulfill the role of assistance but never
men this goes hand in hand with the
Catholic Church's direct prohibition
against abortion and birth control
making the environment not so friendly
towards women
another surprising practice that the
Opus day still does is the mortification
of Flesh basically putting oneself in
physical pain or discomfort to repent
for their sins and do as Christ did and
suffer for God while the official
website of the Opus day denies any

their organization they go about

Christ's passion shows that voluntary

this potentially means that while the

Flesh they may be heavily implying that
mortification is good and beneficial as
they even mention that the Catholic
greats like popes and Saints do it or
the Opus day is straight up lying
Opus day is a cesspool of controversies
more so than many other Catholic
institutions the Jesuits are heavily

claiming that the Opus day is very

masonry it isn't just the Jesuits that

using love bombing or showering

ex-supporters even mentioned that

former numerary Joseph Gonzalez says
during my stint as a numerary I

usually Protestant Bibles and books on
the theory of evolution as expected Opus
day denies refreshing their members

members freedom is an essential
condition for Opus day's very existence
the factors contributing to Opus day's

permission by their leaders lastly
another heavily criticized part of the

day has become a church in a church

combination of dated beliefs

hurt themselves as a way to repent such
controversies such as burning books
because it's in the organization's
forbidden list and having women serve
men as part of their duties is is only
the tip of the iceberg regardless the
reach of Opus day is increasing by the
day and soon enough many speculate that
it'll soon reach 100 000 members which
can be a good thing if it truly is an
